commitResults.messageTitle: [#1448] UG: remove need for personal access token for publish-reposense (#1465)
commitResults.messageBody:
Users need to specify a personal access token or a deploy key to
automate the generation of the RepoSense report. This is an
additional step that makes using this repository less
user-friendly for new users.

Let's update the documentation to remove the need for the user to
generate a personal access token, since the GITHUB_TOKEN is
automatically used when generating a report in GitHub Actions.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1184] Test: improve assertion of authors for file analysis (#1518)
commitResults.messageBody:
The assertion used in checking the correctness of the attribution
of authors is not entirely robust and can be prone to other errors
which may not be detected.

Let's refactor the assertion used in file and annotation analysis
such that they use the same function and make the tests more
robust.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#634] Extract time-based functionalities to TimeUtil (#1535)
commitResults.messageBody:
Many of the time-based functionality and logic are scattered about 
in various files, which increases code duplication and is a 
maintenance burden.

Let's abstract all time-based functionalities into the `TimeUtil`
class such that multiple places in the code can reuse the same
logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: UG: Update documentation on using RepoSense at a specific commit (#1516)
commitResults.messageBody:
The script to obtain RepoSense in `publish-RepoSense` supports a way 
to use RepoSense at a specific commit. 

Let's update the documentation to showcase the functionality for
checking out and using RepoSense at a specific commit.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#634] Move logic for getting ReportConfiguration to ArgsParser (#1534)
commitResults.messageBody:
The design of getting the `ReportConfiguration` object in the main 
RepoSense class is flawed and not so ideal, as it meant that 
configuration has to be set and parsed twice.

Let's move the logic for getting the ReportConfiguration object
into ArgsParser to avoid having to duplicate configuration parsing
in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1435] Expand continuous integration testing to Ubuntu 18.04 and 20.04 (#1503)
commitResults.messageBody:
The continuous integration test suite only runs on Ubuntu 16.04,
which is a relatively older version.

Let's expand the testing to both Ubuntu 18.04 and 20.04 to make
sure that RepoSense works for both environments as well. This is
done by defining a job matrix that can automatically run the same
build steps for all versions of Ubuntu.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1354] Allow disowning of code by using empty author tags (#1520)
commitResults.messageBody:
Empty author tags are assumed to represent the end of an annotation 
block. However, there may be cases where certain code blocks should 
not be attributed to any author. 

The current workaround is to attribute the code to some random 
author, which is not ideal from the user's perspective.

Let's implement new functionality for users to disown code by
using empty author tags.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1349] Clone test repositories only once when testing (#1478)
commitResults.messageBody:
The test repositories are cloned for every test that performs 
cloning, which results in tests taking a long time to complete as
a significant amount of time is spent cloning the same repository
for every test.

Let's prevent the deletion of the cloned test repositories until
we are sure that all tests have completed, thus allowing the test
repositories to be cloned only once during each test run.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1493] DevOps Guide: move from Wiki to DG (#1548)
commitResults.messageBody:
The DevOps guide was originally created in the wiki as a draft, and it 
should be moved to the RepoSense developer guide for better visibility.

Let's move the contents of that wiki page into a new page in the
developer guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1485] Watch tab info directly (#1490)
commitResults.messageBody:
Zoom tab does not update properly if one of the zoom watchables do 
not change.

Let's watch the `tabZoomInfo` stored in `Vuex` instead of 
`zoomOwnerWatchable`. This works as we ensure that every change to 
`tabZoomInfo` stored in `Vuex` replaces `tabZoomInfo` with a new 
object. 

Everything here also applies to the authorship tab with
`authorshipOwnerWatchable` and `tabAuthorshipInfo` instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: Frontend: upgrade minimatch version (#1511)
commitResults.messageBody:
minimatch@1.0.0 is deprecated and will cause potential vulnerability.

Let's upgrade it to minimatch@3.0.4.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1397, #1460] Charts panel: header info misplaced (#1467)
commitResults.messageBody:
Long `chart__contribution` bars in chart view can overflow and
cause some visual bugs.

Let's remove `overflow: visible;` and tweak the CSS slightly to fix
the bug.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove duplicate initiate in v_zoom
commitResults.messageBody:
Some code in v_zoom.js was accidentally duplicated. This a 
regression caused by #1419.

Let's remove the duplicated code.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1473] Add `this.getFiltered()` to set checkedFileTypes (#1475)
commitResults.messageBody:
`this.getFiltered()` is not called when `checkAllFileTypes` is 
modified. This is regression introduced by PR #1440.

Let's call `this.getFiltered()` when `checkAllFileTypes` is 
modified.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1116] Code Panel: weird syntax highlighting (#1521)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense frontend is using `highlightjs@9.14` which has some 
highlighting issues.

These issues were fixed by the following PR in `highlightjs`:
https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js/pull/2531

Let's update `highlightjs` to `10.7.1` in RepoSense.

commitResults.messageTitle: Frontend Test: upgrade cypress version to ^7.0.1 (#1529)
commitResults.messageBody:
We are using Cypress major release version 3. Cypress 3.8.3 was 
released in January 2020 and is using outdated dependencies with 
security vulnerabilities. The latest version of Cypress is 7.0.1.

Let's upgrade Cypress major release version to 7 and also fix the 
test bugs introduced by the API change.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1512] Seemingly random disappearance of dates (#1513)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a possibility that in `v_summary.js`, both `minDate`
and `tmpFilterSinceDate` are empty strings. This leads to bugs where 
both  `minDate` and `tmpFilterSinceDate` cannot be set.

Let's set `minDate` to `window.app.sinceDate`. This is possible as 
`api.loadSummary()` must be run in order for `userUpdated` to be set 
to true in 'main.js`, and hence `v-summary.js` will not load before 
this.

Let's remove the `getDates()` function in `v_summary`. This is 
possible as `tmpFilterSinceDate` does not need to be set, as its 
only dependency is `filterSinceDate` which checks that 
`tmpFilterSinceDate` is empty.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove `window.app` state changes and remove `this.` in `.pug` (#1527)
commitResults.messageBody:
Assignment to window.app is being done in `api.js` and 
`authorship.js` to change the state of the topmost Vue component. 
These state changes are hard to track and breaks 
projectify-frontend.

Using `this.` in template files is unnecessary and causing some
problems in projectify-frontend.

Let's 
- remove all property changes to `window.app`.
- remove all `this.` in `.pug` files.
- move hashing of tabOpen to `store.js`.
- have `v_resizer` get `isTabActive` directly from Vuex.

* remove .app in summary.js

Co-authored-by: WANG CHAO <1229983126@qq.com>
Co-authored-by: Hsu Zhong Jun <27919917+dcshzj@users.noreply.github.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Cypress: add test for tabs rendering (#1443)
commitResults.messageBody:
PR #1390 introduces non-trivial front-end changes to the way to 
render tabs. Frontend tests for these changes are required to 
prevent regressions.

Let's,
- add tests to check if default states remain upon page refreshing 
  and tab switching for authorship and zoom tabs
- add tests to ensure information from previously visited tabs are 
  not retained.

commitResults.messageTitle: Set MarkBind version to 2.18.1
integration.yml: Fix MarkBind version to 2.18.1
[#1229] Select a consistent group name when grouped by author (#1461)
commitResults.messageBody:
The display name of the author changes when the report is 
`grouped by author` and the category to `sort within group` changes, 
which also changes the position of the author group.

Selecting a consistent author group name will make it more 
convenient for the user when changing the `sort within group` 
category in a report `grouped by author`.

Let's select a consistent group name when `grouped by author`.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1472] DG: add release guide (#1474)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no detailed guide on how to make release for the project on 
Github, which can cause issue especially when the release is made on 
a frequent basis.

Add a release guide can provide clear instruction for the developer 
who needs to make a release.

Let's add a release guide to the Developer Guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1464] Remove group highlight when merging group (#1466)
commitResults.messageBody:
A merged group will be highlighted in the summary view even if the 
tab is not on the merged group but a member of the group.

Removing the group highlight in this situation can make the 
highlight provide more accurate information.

Let's remove the group highlight when merging a group.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1486] Frontend: rename zIsMerge to zIsMerged (#1487)
commitResults.messageBody:
The zoom panel of a merged group currently cannot be restored after 
reloading the page. This is caused by incomplete renaming of the 
zIsMerge argument in #1457.

Renaming other instances of zIsMerge can resolve this issue and make 
the reloading behavior more consistent with the user expectation.

Let's change all instances of zIsMerge to zIsMerged.

commitResults.messageTitle: DG: add link to first-timer issues (#1492)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no link to first-timer issues in DG.

Providing the link to the guide can give newcomers a clearer
direction of what to work on in the first place.

Let's add the link to the first-timers issues in DG.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1476] Remove the highlighting when the panel is closed (#1480)
commitResults.messageBody:
The highlighting of the selected tab on the summary view is present
even when the panel is closed.

Removing the highlighting will make the indicated tab information
more consistent.

Let's remove the highlighting when closing the panel.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add link to path glob syntax in the User Guide (#1541)
commitResults.messageBody:
The path glob syntax used in the Ignore Glob List column of the CSV 
configuration files is not documented for the user. This can cause 
issues when an invalid path glob is used to generate the report.

Adding a link to the official documentation will make it more 
convenient to the user.

Let's add the link to the glob syntax in the User Guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1190] Add message for invalid repository link on the summary view (#1509)
commitResults.messageBody:
The report generated does not show alert message for link given by 
the user that cannot be recognized as a repository path.

Showing the message that the link provided is invalid can help the 
user to identify the reason why some repository is not shown in the 
report.

Let's add message for invalid link on the summary view.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1500] Add a Learn basics section to the DG (#1507)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no elaborate guide for new developers to systematically 
learn the tool and technologies needed to work on the project.

Add a Learning Guide can give new developers a clear direction of 
what to learn and how to get started.

Let's add a Learning Guide to the Developer Guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement shallow cloning (#1449)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense downloads the entire commit history of the repo when 
cloning it. 

This results in a lot of unnecessary history being downloaded, which 
increases the size of the cloned repo and slows down the time taken 
to clone the repo.

Let's implement Git's shallow cloning functionality so as to 
truncate the downloaded history thereby reducing the size of the 
cloned repo and speeding up the cloning process.

commitResults.messageTitle: CSVParser: check column headers when parsing config CSV files (#1459)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense parses the config CSV files purely based on column order. 

This means that every column needs to be present in the correct 
order (even if the column is optional) in order for the CSV
file to be parsed. This additionally means that every time we add a
new column to a config CSV, we would break compatibility with 
existing config CSV files for all users.

Let's change the `CSVParser` to verify and parse the config CSV 
files based on the column headers. This would allow us to parse 
config CSVs with columns in a different order or with some 
(optional) columns missing.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1452] Implement multi-threading (#1451)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense runs cloning and analysis of 1 repo each in parallel.

Let's implement multi-threading to increase the number of repos 
being analyzed in parallel, which can speed up the report generation 
when running RepoSense on a large number of repos.

commitResults.messageTitle: UG: reflect new method of CSV parsing (#1523)
commitResults.messageBody:
User Guide states that "RepoSense ignores the first row (i.e., 
column headings) of CSV config files". However, as of #1459, this is 
no longer true.

Let's change the User Guide to reflect the new method of CSV 
parsing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add warning when there are a large number of files to be analyzed (#1524)
commitResults.messageBody:
If RepoSense is run on a repo with a large number of text files 
(with a large number of lines overall), it can take a long time to 
generate the authorship report. Additionally, the size of the 
`authorship.json` file can be very large, possibly even exceeding 
the file size limit of 100 MB for GitHub, which would prevent the 
report from being deployed on GitHub Pages.

Let's add a warning when there are a large number of text files with 
a large number of lines overall. This would let users know the 
reason why they may experience slow performance and would also 
advise users on how they can reduce the number of files to be 
analyzed using `repo-config.csv`.
